title: Video: Willis Earl Beal – Evening’s Kiss
content:
As an artist who once said “I want be like the black Tom Waits”, Willis Earl Beal certainly has a lot to live up to; I mean, he’s going to be a different colour for crying out loud. Progressive shit. Skin pigment complexities aside, Beal happens to be one of the most exciting (anti) folk artists to emerge this year, and with XL due to drop an LP some time this year, the future is undoubtedly bright.

The new video for his new single, ‘Evening’s kiss’, mirrors the track’s fragility perfectly, with the stop motion illustrations flickering with a sober murmur of awkward resilience. It actually reminds me of the film Waking Life by Richard Linklater, but that could just be me.
